clinical_study.brief_title: A Novel Approach to Posterior Mesh Fixation in Laparoscopic Sacral Colpopexy
clinical_study.official_title: A Novel Approach to Posterior Mesh Fixation in Laparoscopic Sacral Colpopexy: a Randomized Control Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Catholic University of the Sacred Heart

clinical_study.source: Catholic University of the Sacred Heart

brief_summary.textblock: This randomized controlled study is designed to test the non inferiority of no attachment of posterior mesh compared to fixation of posterior mesh to the vagina in laparoscopic sacral colpopexy in terms of anatomical correction of the prolapse, post-operative and long term morbidity and rate of recurrence.

primary_outcome.description: number of women with correction of prolapse mesured in S POP-Q stage during FU visit

secondary_outcome.description: number of women with de novo anterior or posterior or central prolapse
number of women with nicturia, dysuria, obstructed defecation , urinary incontinence, pelvic pain

arm_group.description: laparoscopic sacral colpopexy with no fixation of posterior mesh
laparoscopic sacral colpopexy with fixation of posterior mesh by suture

intervention.intervention_name: laparoscopic sacral colpopexy with posterior mesh no attachment
intervention.description: pelvic organ prolapse correction with laparoscopic sacralcolpopexy with no attachement of posterior mesh

intervention.intervention_name: laparoscopic sacral colpopexy with posterior mesh attachment
intervention.description: pelvic organ prolapse correction with laparoscopic sacralcolpopexy with the attachement of posterior mesh to vagina
